data-th-fragment.description: To add fragment attribute to html element thymeleaf template

data-th-text.description: Display dynamic text in a template.

data-th-utext.description: Display dynamic text in a template, while escaping special characters to prevent XSS attacks.

data-th-object.description: Set the value of an input field, select element, or textarea.

data-th-field.description: To add id, name and value html from element

data-th-id.description: To add id attribute to html element

data-th-name.description: To add the name at html from element

data-th-value.description: Set the value of an input field, select element, or textarea.

data-th-selected.description: To add selected attribute to html element

data-th-replace.description: To replace fragment to html content thymeleaf template

data-th-each.description: To add each loop html element

data-th-if.description: Conditionally include or exclude content based on a Boolean expression.

data-th-unless.description: Conditionally exclude content based on a Boolean expression.

data-th-href.description: Dynamically set the destination URL for a hyperlink.

data-th-style.description: Set the inline style for an element.

data-th-action.description: Specify the URL for form submissions.

data-th-attr.description: Set arbitrary attributes for an element.

data-th-include.description: Include the contents of another template in the current template.

data-th-insert.description: Include the contents of another template in the current template, replacing the contents of an element with an ID that matches the name of the included template.

data-th-block.description: Define a block of content that can be overridden by templates that extend the current template.

data-th-switch.description: Conditionally include content based on the value of a variable.

data-th-case.description: Conjunction with data-th-switch to define a case in a switch statement.

data-th-with.description: Expose a specific object in the model as a local variable, making it easier to access in the template.

data-th-remove.description: Remove an element from the template, including its contents.

th:text.description: Display dynamic text in a template.

th:utext.description: Display dynamic text in a template, while escaping special characters to prevent XSS attacks.

th:name.description: To add the name at html from element

th:object.description: Set the value of an input field, select element, or textarea.

th:value.description: Set the value of an input field, select element, or textarea.

th:field.description: To add id, name and value html from element

th:each.description: To add each loop html element

th:selected.description: To add selected attribute to html element

th:id.description: To add id attribute to html element

th:fragment.description: To add fragment attribute to html element thymeleaf template

th:replace.description: To replace fragment to html content thymeleaf template

th:if.description: Conditionally include or exclude content based on a Boolean expression.

th:unless.description: Conditionally exclude content based on a Boolean expression.

th:href.description: Dynamically set the destination URL for a hyperlink.

th:style.description: Set the inline style for an element.

th:action.description: Specify the URL for form submissions.

th:attr.description: Set arbitrary attributes for an element.

th:include.description: Include the contents of another template in the current template.

th:insert.description: Include the contents of another template in the current template, replacing the contents of an element with an ID that matches the name of the included template.

th:block.description: Define a block of content that can be overridden by templates that extend the current template.

th:switch.description: Conditionally include content based on the value of a variable.

th:case.description: Conjunction with th:switch to define a case in a switch statement.

th:with.description: Expose a specific object in the model as a local variable, making it easier to access in the template.

th:remove.description: Remove an element from the template, including its contents.
